Pages.Title: Authoriser details

Validations.Name: Required
Validations.ErrorMessage: Enter the name of the person named as authoriser

Validations.Name: Required
Validations.ErrorMessage: Enter the job title of the person named as authoriser

Pages.BodyText:
Who is signing your application?

Include the name and job title of the person named as authoriser.

Questions.Label: Criminal convictions
Questions.QuestionBodyText:
Has any person of significant control (PSC) in the last 5 years been convicted of:

  • any offence under sections 44 to 46 of the Serious Crime Act 2007 which relates to an offence covered by subparagraph (f)
  • conspiracy within the meaning of section 1 or 1A of the Criminal Law Act 1977
  • conspiracy within article 9 or 9A of the criminal attempts and conspiracy (Northern Ireland) order 1983, relating to participation in a criminal organisation

Validations.Name: Required
Validations.ErrorMessage: Select yes if any convictions apply

Details.Title: What classifies as a person with significant control?
Details.Body: A person with significant control (PSC) is someone who owns or controls your organisation. They're sometimes called 'beneficial owners'

Questions.Label: Financial convictions
Questions.QuestionBodyText:
Has any person of significant control (PSC) in the last 5 years been convicted of fraud affecting European communities, including:

  • the common law offence of cheating the Revenue (HMRC)
  • the common law offence of conspiracy to defraud
  • fraud or theft within the meaning of the Theft Act 1968, the Theft Act (Northern Ireland) 1969, the Theft Act 1978 or the Theft (Northern Ireland) Order 1978
  • fraudulent trading within the meaning of section 458 of the Companies Act 1985, article 451 of the Companies (Northern Ireland) Order 1986 or section 993 of the Companies Act 2006
  • fraudulent evasion within the meaning of section 170 of the Customs and Excise Management Act 1979 or section 72 of the Value Added Tax Act 1994
  • an offence in connection with taxation in the European Union within the meaning of section 71 of the Criminal Justice Act 1993
  • destroying, defacing or concealing of documents or procuring the execution of a valuable security within the meaning of section 20 of the Theft Act 1968 or section 19 of the Theft Act (Northern Ireland) 1969
  • fraud within the meaning of section 2, 3 or 4 of the Fraud Act 2006
  • the possession of articles for use in frauds within the meaning of section 6 of the Fraud Act 2006, or the making, adapting, supplying or offering to supply articles for use in frauds within the meaning of section 7 of that Act

Validations.Name: Required
Validations.ErrorMessage: Select yes if any convictions apply

Questions.Label: Counter terrorism
Questions.QuestionBodyText:
Has any person with significant control in the last 5 years been convicted of:

  • section 41 of the Counter Terrorism Act 2008
  • schedule 2 of the Counter Terrorism Act 2008 where the court has determined that there is a terrorist connection
  • any offence under sections 44 to 46 of the Serious Crime Act 2007

Validations.Name: Required
Validations.ErrorMessage: Select yes if any convictions apply

Questions.Label: Other criminal convictions
Questions.QuestionBodyText:
Has any person of significant control (PSC) in the last 5 years been convicted of:

  • money laundering within the meaning of sections 340(11) and 415 of the Proceeds of Crime Act 2002
  • an offence in connection with the proceeds of criminal conduct within the meaning of section 93A, 93B or 93C of the Criminal Justice Act 1988 or article 45, 46 or 47 of the Proceeds of Crime (Northern Ireland) Order 1996
  • an offence under section 4 of the Asylum and Immigration (Treatment of Claimants etc) Act 2004
  • an offence under section 59A of the Sexual Offences Act 2003
  • an offence under section 71 of the Coroners and Justice Act 2009
  • an offence in connection with the proceeds of drug trafficking within the meaning of section 49, 50 and 51 of the Drug Trafficking Act 1994

Validations.Name: Required
Validations.ErrorMessage: Select yes if any convictions apply

Questions.Label: Tax and social security irregularities
Questions.QuestionBodyText: Has any person of significant control (PSC) breached tax payments or social security contributions?

FurtherQuestions.Label: Provide details whether you've paid, or have entered into a binding arrangement with a view to paying, including, where applicable, any accrued interest and/or fines

Validations.Name: Required
Validations.ErrorMessage: Enter details of payments or payment agreements

Validations.Name: Required
Validations.ErrorMessage: Select yes if any convictions apply

Questions.Label: Bankruptcy and insolvency
Questions.QuestionBodyText:
In the past 3 years has your organisation or partner organisation:

  • been made bankrupt
  • been the subject of insolvency
  • started winding-up proceedings

Validations.Name: Required
Validations.ErrorMessage: Select yes if any bankruptcy or insolvency proceedings apply

Questions.Label: Cessation of trading
Questions.QuestionBodyText:
Confirm whether your organisation or any partner organisation are in:

  • voluntary administration or company voluntary arrangement
  • compulsory winding up
  • receivership
  • composition with creditors

Questions.Label: Incorrect tax returns
Questions.QuestionBodyText:
Have your organisation or partner organisation's tax returns on or after the 1 October 2013:

  • been found to be incorrect as of 1 April 2013
  • resulted in a criminal conviction for tax-related offences which are unspent, or to a civil penalty for fraud or evasion

FurtherQuestions.Label: Provide details of any mitigating factors that you think should be taken into consideration
FurtherQuestions.ShortLabel: Provide details of any mitigating factors that you think should be taken into consideration

Validations.Name: Required
Validations.ErrorMessage: Enter details of any mitigating factors

Validations.Name: Required
Validations.ErrorMessage: Select yes if any tax returns have been found to be incorrect

Questions.Label: HMRC challenges to tax returns
Questions.QuestionBodyText:
Has your organisation or your partner organisation tax returns between 1 October 2012 and 1 April 2013:

  • been successfully challenged by HMRC under the general anti-abuse rule (GAAR) or the Halifax abuse principle
  • been challenged by a tax authority in the jurisdiction your organisation is based with rules or legislation similar to GAAR or Halifax
  • resulted in criminal convictions for tax-related offences which are unspent, or to a civil penalty for fraud or evasion

FurtherQuestions.Label: Provide details of any mitigating factors that you think should be taken into consideration
FurtherQuestions.ShortLabel: Provide details of any mitigating factors that you think should be taken into consideration

Validations.Name: Required
Validations.ErrorMessage: Enter details of any mitigating factors

Validations.Name: Required
Validations.ErrorMessage: Select yes if any tax returns have been found to be incorrect

Questions.Label: Organisation removal from registers
Questions.QuestionBodyText:
Has your organisation been removed from:

  • Education and skills funding agency's register of training organisations (RoATP)
  • End-point assessor organisations (EPAO) register
  • Ofqual's register
  • other professional or trade registers

Validations.Name: Required
Validations.ErrorMessage: Enter a date

Questions.Label: Direction and sanctions
Questions.QuestionBodyText:
Has your organisation received direction or sanctions from any of the following?

  • Ofqual
  • Quality Assurance Agency (QAA) for higher education
  • awarding organisations
  • other similar bodies

Questions.Label: Public body funds and contracts
Questions.QuestionBodyText:
Has any person of significant control in your organisation had:

  • a failure to repay funding due to any public body
  • early termination of a contract with a public body
  • early withdrawal from a contract with a public body

Questions.Label: False declarations
Questions.QuestionBodyText:
I certify that the information provided is accurate and accept the conditions and undertakings requested in this application. It's understood that false information may result in:

  • exclusion from this and future registers
  • the removal from the Register of End-point Assessments Organisations
  • the withdrawal of contracts with employers
  • civil or criminal proceedings

Validations.Name: Required
Validations.ErrorMessage: Select yes if you understand the false declarations statement

Questions.Label: Accurate and true representation
Questions.QuestionBodyText: Will your applications to deliver end-point assessments for standards be accurate and true representations?

Validations.Name: Required
Validations.ErrorMessage: Select yes if your applications to deliver end-point assessments will be accurate and true representations
